name: Peer Providers
description: Peer Providers work together with licensed mental health clinicians, service professionals, and mental health care teams to provide on-going, short-term (60-day), intensive case management and support to clients experiencing pre-, post-, and acute crises. Peers are integrated within the continuum of support and services to stabilize and connect individuals with on-going help. They currently partner with organizations and agencies in San Francisco, Marin County, and Sacramento. Peer Providers als

whatTheyOffer: Peer Providers work together with licensed mental health clinicians, service professionals, and mental health care teams to provide on-going, short-term (60-day), intensive case management and support to clients experiencing pre-, post-, and acute crises. Peers are integrated within the continuum of support and services to stabilize and connect individuals with on-going help. They currently partner with organizations and agencies in San Francisco, Marin County, and Sacramento. Peer Providers als
howToGetIt: Currently, they only work with community agencies and healthcare organizations through joint partnerships. Please contact your case management agency, healthcare provider, or insurance provider to find out if they are a partner organization. If your organization is interested in providing this service through a partnership with MHASF, contact Director of Peer Services, Erik Henriques at erik@mentalhealthsf.org. For behavioral health crises in Marin County, contact the Mobile Crisis Response Team at (415) 473-6392.
address: 870 Market Street, Suite 658, San Francisco, CA, 94102
agency: Mental Health Association of San Francisco (MHASF)
